FacilityName: Engineered Polymer Solutions dba Valspar Coatings

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Engineered Polymer Solutions, d/b/a Valspar Coatings (Valspar) personnel in Fremont, Michigan take great pride in maintaining a safe operation for the employees, the community, and the environment.  The primary focus is to prevent accidental releases before they occur, while providing systems that minimize the  of any release that does occur and contain it in as small as area as possible.


ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES:  It is Valspar's policy to operate its plants in a manner that protect its employees, the public, and the environment.  It is our policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state and local laws.  The Valspar Fremont, Michigan facility has a detailed, practiced Emergency Response Plan that is utilized to respond to any accidental releases.


FACILITY DESCRIPTION:  The Valspar Fremont, Michigan facility manufactures architectural and industrial paint and coatings.  The majority of the paint and coatings manufactured at the plant are filled in pressurized aerosol spray cans.  The facility operates several storage tanks that contain a flammable mixture of propane, n-butane, and/or isobutane that is used as propellants for the aerosol cans.


GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS:  The Fremont, Michigan Facility has implemented the OSHA Process Safety Management Standard, which is a systematic method of preventing accidental releases and complies with EPA's accident prevention rule.  As such, the facility has completed a detailed analysis on the process to ensure the safe use and operation of the applicable equipment.   Numerous safeguards are in place and include Operational Procedures, manual and automated control systems, safety interlocks, and other accepted good engineering and industry practices.  The facility uses both procedural as well as technological systems to ensure safe handling of flammable propellants.


FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY:  The Valspar Fremont, Michig

an plant has never had an accident involving flammable propellants that resulted in injuries, property damage or environmental releases.


EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM:  In the event of an emergency involving flammable propellants, plant personnel will notify the Fremont Fire Department and rely on their expertise to handle the situation.  We have provided the fire department with our Emergency Response Plan and members of the fire department have inspected the plant.  In addition, Valspar has a contract with a qualified emergency response firm to aid in the cleanup of a release.


PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY:  Valspar has an ongoing and continuing process to update and review our manufacturing process for safety considerations.
